questions.question: Question 1: Identify the organization that has the given emblem:

options.a: National Vector Borne Disease Control Programme
options.d: National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular Disease,

questions.explanation:
The given image is the emblem of National Leprosy Eradication Programme (NLEP). Characteristics of NLEP emblem: • The lotus in the NLEP emblem symbolizes beauty and purity. • A partially affected thumb, a normal forefinger, and the shape of a house symbolize that leprosy 
can be cured and a patient with leprosy can be a useful member of the society. • The rising sun symbolizes hope and optimism. • The emblem captures the spirit of hope and positivity in the eradication of leprosy. NLEP is a centrally sponsored health scheme of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Govt. 
of India. Option A: National Vector Borne Disease Control Programme (NVBDCP) Option C: Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) 372 
Sold by @itachibot Option D: National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular 
Disease, and Stroke (NPCDCS).
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 2: The following drug packet is used in: 363 
Sold by @itachibot

options.a: TB
options.d: Gonorrhea

questions.explanation: The given image shows the adult blister packet used in the treatment of leprosy.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 3: The Sparsh campaign was launched to spread awareness about which of the following 
diseases?

options.a: HIV
options.d: TB

questions.explanation:
Sparsh Leprosy Awareness Campaign (SLAC) was introduced in 2017 on the occasion of the 
anti-leprosy day (observed on the last Sunday of January) to promote awareness about various 
aspects of leprosy. 373 
Sold by @itachibot Sapna refers to a local school-going girl who will help to spread awareness in the community. The other developments under NLEP are: • Mycobacterium Indicus Prani (MiP) vaccine for multibacillary leprosy patients and their contacts 
(it is in a project mode). • Nikusth: A web-based system for the data management of leprosy cases. Note: Meena is a nine-year-old girl, who is the symbol of UNICEF's Girl Empowerment 
programme to impart important messages on gender, child rights, education, health and 
development in the South Asian region. The posters below depict the role play by Sapna:
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 4: A patient with leprosy comes to the PHC following a pinprick to his foot. He noticed it only 
after seeing bloodstains on the floor and complains of loss of sensation in his foot. After 
addressing the issue, the patient is referred to another centre. Where has he been referred to 
and why?

options.a: For secondary prevention to a district hospital.
options.b: For tertiary prevention to a district hospital.
options.c: For secondary prevention to a district nucleus.
options.d: For tertiary prevention to a district nucleus.

questions.explanation:
The given clinical scenario of a patient with leprosy having neuropathy needs Micro Cellular 
Rubber (MCR) footwear, which is a form of tertiary prevention. He is to be referred to a 
district nucleus which supplies MCR footwear to patients. 374 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 5: A patient with leprosy, who has completed a course of multi-drug therapy, presents with 
complaints of developing painful, tender, and raised lesions on his forehead recently as 
shown in the image below. What is the first-line treatment for him?

options.a: Restart multi drug therapy and start thalidomide
options.b: Restart multi drug therapy and start prednisolone
options.d: Start on prednisolone only

questions.explanation:
The presence of new erythematous and tender subcutaneous nodules in a patient with leprosy 
indicates that he has developed type II lepra reaction. It is also known as Erythema Nodosum 
Leprosum (ENL) and the first line of treatment is prednisolone. Multi-drug therapy (MDT) should not be restarted in patients who develop lepra reactions after 
the completion of treatment. Prednisolone is started at a dose of 40 mg per day and gradually tapered by ˜ mg every 2 weeks. 
'Prednisolone card' is given when treatment is started. If the patient becomes steroid-dependent, 
then clofazimine is added. The key targets of the Global Leprosy Strategy 2021-202è announced by WHO (Accelerating 
towards a leprosy-free world) are: • 120 countries reporting zero new autochthonous cases. • 70% reduction in the annual number of new cases detected. • ù0% reduction in rate per million population of new cases with Grade 2 disability. • ù0% reduction in rate per million children of new child cases with leprosy. The current goal is the elimination of leprosy.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 6: ABSULS, which is an ASHA-based surveillance project, has been initiated for which of the 
following diseases?

options.a: Leishmaniasis
options.d: Sexually Transmitted Diseases (STDs)

questions.explanation:
ABSULS which stands for Asha Based Surveillance for Leprosy Suspects has been initiated to 
prioritize leprosy case detection by ASHAs. 375 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 7: 365 
Sold by @itachibot The treatment of paucibacillary leprosy consists of MDT (which comprises rifampicin, 
dapsone, and clofazimine). The latest recommended regimen is:

options.a: 2 drug therapy for Ž months
options.d: è drug therapy for Ž months

questions.explanation:
The latest recommendation is è drug therapy for Ž months to treat paucibacillary (PB) leprosy by 
WHO. The regimen consists of rifampicin, dapsone, and clofazimine. Meanwhile, multibacillary (MB) leprosy is treated using the same è drugs for a duration of 12 
months. While the NLEP guidelines earlier mentioned a 2-drug MDT for PB leprosy, the National 
Strategic Plan and Roadmap for Leprosy (202è-2027) now recommends a uniform MDT of è 
drugs for both PB and MB leprosy. Note: The central government has approved a new treatment regimen for paucibacillary (PB) 
leprosy. The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has introduced a è-drug regimen for PB 
leprosy instead of a 2-drug regimen. This revised drug regimen will be applicable in India from 
April 1, 202˜.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 8: A District Leprosy Officer is preparing the annual report as per NLEP 2020. Which of the 
following parameters would he not consider as an essential indicator?

options.a: Treatment Completion Rate (TCR)
options.c: Rate of new cases with Grade II disabilities per 10 lakh population per year
options.d: Proportion of new cases correctly diagnosed

questions.explanation:
The proportion of new cases correctly diagnosed is not included under essential indicators. It is a 
part of the quality of service indicators as per NLEP 2020. The essential indicators include: • Annual new case detection rate (ANCDR) per 1 lakh population. • Rate of new cases with grade II disabilities (G2D) per 10 lakh population per year. • Treatment completion rate (TCR) as a proxy to cure rate. • Prevalence rate (PR). Additional epidemiological indicators include: • Proportion of Grade II disabilities among new cases. • Proportion of females among new cases. • Proportion of multibacillary (MB) among new cases. • Proportion of child (0- 14 years) among new cases. • Child rate per 100,000 population. • Scheduled Caste New Case Detection Rate.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question: Question 9: As per NLEP 2020, which of the following is not a quality of service indicator?

options.a: Patient month blister calendar pack stock
options.b: Proportion of grade II disabilities among new cases.
options.d: Proportion of cases who developed new or additional disability after starting MDT

questions.explanation:
Proportion of grade II disabilities among new cases is not a quality of service indicator. It is an 
additional epidemiological indicator as per NLEP 2020. The quality of service indicators are: • Patient month blister calendar pack stock. • Absolute number of patients made released from treatment (RFT). 376 
Sold by @itachibot • Number of relapse reported. • Proportion of cases who developed new or additional disability after starting MDT. • Proportion of treatment defaulters. • Proportion of new cases correctly diagnosed.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 10: You are part of a rural health camp organized under Project Axshya. Which of the following 
diseases does it aim to control?

options.a: Diabetes
options.d: Zika Virus disease

questions.explanation:
Project Axshya was launched in 2010 to control TB. Axshya means free from TB which is the 
ultimate goal of the project and the National TB Elimination Programme. Project Axshya is being implemented by the International Union Against Tuberculosis and Lung 
Disease (known simply as The Union). The project works to improve access to quality TB care and 
control through a partnership between the government and civil society. The guiding principles of project Axshya are: • Universal access to quality TB services • Community participation in TB care and control • Sustainable interventions and equitable distribution of project benefits with social and gender 
sensitivity
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 11: You are working as a medical officer in a PHC where you diagnose a patient with TB. Within 
how many days do you have to report it to the District Health Officer?

options.a: 7 days
options.d: 21 days

questions.explanation:
The guidelines for TB notification under the RNTCP is within è0 days (a month) of receiving a 
new case. The notification must be done to the District Health Officer or the Chief Medical Officer 
of a District Hospital by the practitioner who diagnosed it. Note: RNTCP has now been renamed to National Tuberculosis Elimination Program (NTEP).
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question: Question 12: Which of the following is true about the Revised National Tuberculosis Control Programme?

options.a: Follow-up sputum smear examination at the end of intensive phase only
options.b: Directly Observed Treatment Short course strategy is applied
options.c: Treatment is only given to smear positive cases
options.d: MDR TB is resistance to either rifampicin or isoniazid

questions.explanation:
DOTS stands for Directly Observed Treatment Short-course and is given by peripheral and 
voluntary health workers. Recent updates in RNTCP: • Active case finding for TB has been started. • Follow up: • On treatment: monthly follow up. • After treatment: Follow up at Ž, 12, 1š and 24 months. • A sputum smear examination must be done at the end of intensive phase (IP) and at the end of 
treatment. 377 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 13: A patient presents with fever, productive cough, and weight loss. He gives a history of not 
having completed treatment for tuberculosis thrice in the past. Extensively drug-resistant TB 
is suspected. How is this entity defined?

options.a: Resistance to INH + Amikacin + Ofloxacin + Ethambutol
options.d: Resistance to INH + Rifampicin + Ofloxacin + Linezolid

questions.explanation:
™DR-TB (extensively drug-resistant TB) is defined as multi-drug resistant TB (resistant to 
rifampicin and isoniazid) which is also resistant to one fluoroquinolone (eg. ofloxacin) 
AND resistant to atleast one additional group A drug (as of 2021, these 
are bedaquiline and linezolid) It is usually seen in patients who have previously received treatment for TB and have either failed 
to complete treatment or relapsed.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 14: A patient on HAART presents with complaints of fever and expectorant cough for two weeks. 
What is the investigation to be ordered first?

options.a: Sputum microscopy
options.d: Sputum microscopy and Chest ™-ray

questions.explanation:
An HIV patient suspected to have TB is directly investigated by CB-NAAT (Cartridge Based 
Nucleic Acid Amplification Test). TB is a very serious infection in the immunocompromised and can lead to its most severe form as 
miliary TB and cause death. Since TB in HIV does not have its typical presentation, early 
suspicion and advanced diagnosis is the key to preventing mortality. Diagnostic algorithm for TB:
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 15: Which of the following statements is false under the National Tuberculosis Elimination 
Programme?

options.a: Continuation phase for new sputum smear positive: HRE for 1Ž weeks
options.b: Intensive phase for sputum smear positive after loss to follow up: HRZE for š weeks
options.c: Continuation phase for sputum smear positive recurrent case: HRE for 1Ž weeks
options.d: Intensive phase for sputum smear positive after failure to treatment: HRZES for 12 weeks

questions.explanation:
Under National Tuberculosis Elimination Programme (NTEP) guidelines Initiation phase (IP) for 
both new and previously treated cases which are H and R sensitive is HRZE for š weeks. 378 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 16: Which of the following is the most peripheral centre under the Revised National Tuberculosis 
Control Programme organization structure?

options.a: District TB centre
options.d: Designated Microscopy Centre

questions.explanation: Among the options given, Designated Microscopy Centre is the most peripheral centre.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 17: Which is the new online software launched under the national tuberculosis elimination 
program (NTEP) by the government to monitor TB patients?

options.a: NIKSHAY
options.d: NIKUSTH

questions.explanation:
Nikshay is the new online software launched under the national tuberculosis elimination program 
for monitoring TB patients. Nikusth is the new online software for monitoring leprosy patients. Nischay is a pregnancy test kit.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question: Question 18: Choose the false statement regarding the initiatives and strategies for tuberculosis.

options.a: The Stop TB strategy was announced by the World Health Organisation
options.b: The STOP TB strategy has a target of ending TB by achieving an incidence rate of <10 people
options.c: The "Practical approach to lung health" was launched by the WHO for syndromic managment
options.d: The End TB strategy is a 20 year programme

questions.explanation:
The Stop TB strategy was announced by World Health Organisation to reduce the global burden 
of TB by 201˜ (and not ending TB). The End TB strategy is a 20-year programme with tagline “A world free of TB - Zero TB deaths, 
Zero TB disease, and Zero TB suffering”. It aims to: • end TB by achieving an incidence rate of <10 people/1 lakh population per year by 20è˜. • reduce TB deaths by ù˜% and cut new cases by ù0% by 20è˜. The "Practical approach to lung health initiative" was launched by the WHO as a syndromic 
approach to the management of patients who attend primary health care services for respiratory 
symptoms. Ending the TB epidemic is also one of the targets of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) 
specifically under Goal è (to “ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages”). 379 
Sold by @itachibot WHO defines that "Tuberculosis control" would be achieved when the prevalence of the natural 
order of infection in the age group of 0-14 years is of the order of 1% (40% in India currently). Vision of End TB: A world fre 
e of TB- zero deaths, disease 
and suffering due to TB Goal: End the global TB epid 
emic Indicators 
Targets SDG 20è0 
End TB 20è˜ Reduction in no. of TB death 
s compared with 201˜ ù0% 
ù˜% Reduction in TB incidence ra 
te compared with 201˜ ù0%(<10/1,00,0

tastrophic costs due to TB
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 19: Which of the following group of individuals would you not target under the programme 
represented by the logo shown below?

options.a: Sex workers
options.d: Industrial workers

questions.explanation:
The red ribbon shown is a part of the logo of the National AIDS Control Organization (NACO) 
programme. Industrial workers are not included in the target population under NACO. Target interventions for the control of AIDS transmission are done for: • High-risk groups like sex workers • Men who have sex with men • Transgender • Injecting drug users • Bridge population like migrants and long-distance truckers The services offered through targeted interventions include detection and treatment for sexually 
transmitted diseases and condom distribution. The logo of NACO: 380 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 20: Which of the following statements is false regarding the target interventions under National 
AIDS Control Organisation?

options.a: Lubricants are given to homosexual men
options.b: Clean needles and syringes are given to injecting drug users
options.c: Condoms are not given to bridge population
options.d: Opioid substitution therapy is given to Injecting Drug Users

questions.explanation: Bridge populations are supplied with condoms under the NACO target interventions. Target interventions: General: • Detection and treatment for sexually transmitted diseases • Condom distribution For injecting drug users: • Distribution of clean needles and syringes. • Abscess prevention and management. • Opioid substitution therapy. • Linkage with detoxification and rehabilitation services. For homosexual men and transgenders: • Provision of lubricants. • Provision of project-based clinics for sexually transmitted infections.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question: Question 21: A physician follows the two test protocol for the diagnosis of HIV in a patient. It consists of:

options.a: Western blot as the first test
options.b: Line immunoassay as the second test
options.c: HIV ELISA as the second test
options.d: Western blot as the second test

questions.explanation:
The two test protocol for the diagnosis of HIV consists of ELISA as the second test. If the initial 
ELISA is positive, a second ELISA is carried out. If the second ELISA is also positive, only then 
the case is reported to be positive. Investigations involved in HIV testing strategies: 381 
Sold by @itachibot • ELISA/ rapid tests. • Confirmatory tests with high specificity like western blot and line immunoassays are used in 
problem cases eg: indeterminate/ discordant cases of rapid tests. In India, NACO provides western blot (WB) confirmatory testing only to resolve indeterminate 
results on previous serological testing. It is not used for routine confirmation after a positive 
result on screening tests. Drawbacks of WB include low rates of detection during acute 
HIV infection and misclassification of HIV-2 infection. Note: The western blot is used as a confirmatory test after 2 indeterminate primary tests (ELISA). 
It is essentially the third test used and does not fit into the two test protocol.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question:
Question 22: As a medical officer involved in the sentinel surveillance for HIV under the National AIDS 
Control Programme, your duties include all of the following except:

options.a: Estimation of total infection in the community
options.b: Estimation of total cases in hospitals
options.d: Classification of districts

questions.explanation:
As a medical officer involved in the sentinel surveillance, the estimation of total cases in hospitals 
is not included in the sentinel surveillance for HIV under National AIDS Control Programme 
(NACO). The aims of the HIV sentinel surveillance include: • Determine the level of HIV infection in the community. • Understand the trends of HIV epidemic. • Understand the geographical spread of HIV infection and classify districts according to 
epidemiological and vulnerability criteria. These objectives are achieved by conducting annual cross-sectional surveys of the risk group in 
the same geographical place.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question: Question 23: Which of the following is targetted by the establishment bearing the logo shown below:

options.a: Family planning
options.d: Maternal and Child Health Services

questions.explanation:
The logo shown represents Suraksha Clinics which are established for the management of sexually 
transmitted diseases (STDs) where patients are given color-coded kits.
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO

questions.question: Question 24: Choose the wrong combination of the colour-coded STI kits among the given options.

options.a: OPV booster, DPT booster and Vitamin A
options.b: OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, JE and Vitamin A
options.c: OPV booster, DPT booster, JE vaccine and Vitamin A
options.d: OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR and Vitamin A

questions.explanation:
Kit 4 is blue in colour and is used for genital ulcers. These kits are given at Suraksha clinics. 382 
Sold by @itachibot National Health Programmes III - NIS, JSY, RBSK and Others
questions.chapter_heading: National Health Programmes II - NLEP  NTEP   NACO
